article_title: Medicare and Social Security Costs? Out of Sight, Out of Mind
article_text:
Two words seem to be slipping from the Washington vernacular: entitlement reform.

There was a time, not long ago, when both parties were at least paying lip service to the idea that the Social Security and Medicare entitlement programs—their long-term solvency in peril, their contributions to long-term deficits and debt daunting—needed to be adjusted before they either broke the bank or failed future retirees.

Now a...

twitter.description: Capital Journal:The need for sustained discussion and tough decisions to reduce the long-term cost of Medicare and Social Security is as real as ever, and the cost of avoiding it continues to rise, Washington Bureau Chief Gerald F. Seib writes.
twitter.title: Medicare and Social Security Costs? Out of Sight, Out of Mind

article_metadata.article.origheadline: Medicare and Social Security Costs? Out of Sight, Out of Mind

article_summary:
Two words seem to be slipping from the Washington vernacular: entitlement reform.
There was a time, not long ago, when both parties were at least paying lip service to the idea that the Social Security and Medicare entitlement programs—their long-term solvency in peril, their contributions to long-term deficits and debt daunting—needed to be adjusted before they either broke the bank or failed future retirees.
